channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Target cuts sales outlook as retailer blames tariff uncertainty and backlash to DEI rollback
item.description: Target missed first-quarter sales estimates and said it was setting up a new office to try to accelerate its turnaround.

item.title: Lowe's sticks by full-year forecast as sales from home professionals boost business
item.description: Lowe's said it's on track for year over year sales growth, despite slower housing turnover and unfavorable weather early in the year.

item.title: Canada Goose shares soar 20% as company beats estimates, pulls full-year guidance
item.description: Shares of Canada Goose rose 20% after the company reported fiscal fourth-quarter earnings that beat analysts' estimates.

item.title: Xpeng shares rise, adding to 66% rally after the Chinese EV maker's losses narrowed
item.description: Xpeng said it expects to deliver between 102,000 and 108,000 of its electric cars in the second quarter of this year.

item.title: CoreWeave CEO defends capex plans, says company is meeting 'demand signals' from major hyperscalers
item.description: The renter of Nvidia-powered AI servers said it expects capex of $20 billion to $23 billion for the year.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trumpâ€™s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...
